sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Russian Defense Ministry shared videos on Saturday showing people joining what they call the mobilization effort after Russian President Vladimir Putin announced earlier this week a partial mobilization of reservists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: According to the Russian military, at least 10,000 people volunteered to fight in the 24 hours following the call.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.sentence: I was called.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's my duty to defend my homeland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Petropavlovsk-Yamshatskaya, where these reservists have come, the soldiers will go through full health checks before beginning their combat training.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And according to Russian media, any troops refusing to fight, disobeying, surrendering or deserting could now face a jail sentence of up to 10 years after Putin signed a new law earlier this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And on the Georgia-Russia border, the cameras show a story of people desperately trying to leave the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Traffic jams even reached up to 10 kilometers long.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The majority of people don't know what to do.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Many can't leave. More than 70% of the population doesn't have a passport.

sentences.sentence: There were similar scenes on the Finland-Russia land border, where officials reported a 107% increase in crossings over the course of the week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Mariupol and Donetsk, Russian television has filmed these images to portray some form of legitimacy. But a clearer picture of conditions in the region can be seen in Zaporizhia.

sentences.sentence: Russian shelling continues to ravage the Ukrainian side and renewed attacks near the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant are heightening fears of a potential disaster.

sentences.sentence: The world will react absolutely justly to pseudo-referenda. They will be unequivocally condemned and to the criminal mobilisation that the occupiers are currently trying to carry out in Crimea and other parts of Ukraine, which they control for now.

sentences.sentence: Since Russia announced the mobilization on Wednesday, one-way tickets out of the country have skyrocketed in price or sold out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Iranian regime showed its popular support on Friday in Tehran, where hundreds of demonstrators took a stand in favor of the Ayatollahs and the mandatory veiling of women, calling for those who demonstrate against the veil to be executed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Iran's president has compared the protesters to enemies of the state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They want to ride a wave and create riots and disturbances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They think with such moves they can stop the nation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We have announced many times that if anyone has a fair comment, we will listen to it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But anarchy, disturbing national security, the security of people, no one will succumb to this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Following a week of demonstrations over the death of 22-year-old Masa Amini while in police custody, the death toll has risen to 26.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Following the path of their compatriots across Iran, dozens of Iranians have protested by

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: cutting their hair and burning hijabs in front of the Iranian embassy in Brussels. An outcry against the regime has also been heard outside the embassy in Norway.

Bodies of some of the 77 people killed when a vessel carrying migrants capsized off the Syrian coast were returned to Tripoli and without pouring with anger, sorrow and gunfire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Among them Palestinians, Syrians and Lebanese who were trying to reach Cyprus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Just one more day until around 51 million Italians hit the polls to elect a new parliament, with the whole world watching.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: For the first time in the history of the republic, even teenagers from 18 years old will be voting for the Senate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It is also the first time there will be a parliament with reduced ranks, with 600 elected representatives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Italian electoral law is a parallel voting system,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: which acts as a mixed method.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: 37% of seats allocated use a first-past-the-post electoral process, and 61% are determined proportionally with one round of voting. The proportional system also provides a barrier threshold, a minimum percentage of votes that parties and coalitions must reach at a national level to enter Parliament. The threshold is equal to 3% for the single party and 10% for the coalition. 2% of parliamentarians will be elected by Italians abroad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Italy's leaders have held their final rallies ahead of tomorrow's election that is expected to be won by a right-wing alliance, putting Rome on a possible collision course with Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Canada, preparations were firmly in place for the arrival of Hurricane Fiona.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Strong winds and heavy rain struck its Atlantic coast in what meteorologists said could be one of the most severe storms in the country's history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Parts of Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island and New Brunswick experienced torrential rain and winds of nearly 150 km per hour. Residents there had been bracing themselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I've got lots of food in my freezer. I lived through one. I did five days without power for one. Better to be safe than sorry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's something completely new to us. We're used to winter blizzards and whatnot, but not the hurricanes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Bermuda is facing power outages and minor damage after Hurricane Fiona swept past the Atlantic island overnight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Emergency officials urged residents to stay indoors as strong winds of more than 160 kilometers per hour raked over the British territory and sent waves pounding into its coastline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Swiss tennis legend Roger Federer said an emotional farewell to the game before a capacity

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: crowd at London's O2 Arena.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: After falling just short of a fairytale ending of a victory in his final match, the 41-year-old was given a standing ovation by friends, family and former opponents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Federer was the first player to win 20 Grand Slam titles in a career spanning over two decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Famed for a best-selling Wolf Hall trilogy, British author Dame Hilary Mantel has died at the age of 70.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Her publisher HarperCollins said she died suddenly yet peacefully on Thursday, surrounded by loved ones after suffering a stroke.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Mantel had been a published novelist for almost 25 years when her first wolfhole book made her a literary superstar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: five years when her first Wolf Hall book made her a literary superstar. The trilogy is a fictional account of Thomas Cromwell's rise to power in the court of Henry the Eighth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's sold more than five million copies globally and has been translated into 41 languages.
